title: Foundation: Gain Agricultural & Business Knowledge
description: A formal education is highly beneficial. A degree in Agricultural Science provides the technical knowledge, while a degree in Business Management provides the commercial skills. A combination, like a degree in Agricultural Technology & Management, is ideal.

title: Identify a Niche and Gain Practical Experience
description: Work in the agricultural sector to understand the supply chain, challenges, and opportunities firsthand. Identify a specific problem or market gap. This could be in areas like high-tech farming (hydroponics), value-added products, organic farming, or farm-to-consumer logistics.
qualifications: Hands-on experience in the agri sector
institutes: Working for an existing agribusiness company (e.g., CIC, Hayleys Agriculture)

title: Develop a Business Plan & Secure Initial Funding
description: Create a detailed business plan outlining your product/service, target market, marketing strategy, operations, and financial projections. Secure startup capital, which could be from personal savings, family, bank loans (e.g., SME loans), or government grants.
institutes: Banks with SME loan schemes (BOC, People's Bank)

title: Launch and Operate the Business (Pilot Phase)
description: Start small. Launch a pilot version of your business to test your assumptions and refine your processes. This is the stage of intense hands-on work, managing everything from production and operations to sales and customer service.

title: Scale and Grow the Agribusiness
description: Once you have a proven and profitable model, focus on scaling the business. This may involve expanding production, entering new markets, hiring employees, and building a brand. The goal is to grow from a small operation to a sustainable, large-scale enterprise.
